node.Title: A decision model for an MCDM problem
node.Description: This is a decision for an MCDM problem that addresses...

node.Title: Functional appropriateness
node.Description: degree to which the functions facilitate the accomplishment of specified tasks and objectives

node.Title: Functional completeness
node.Description: degree to which the set of functions covers all the specified tasks and user objectives

node.Title: Functional correctness
node.Description: degree to which a product or system provides the correct results with the needed degree of precision

node.Title: Functional suitability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system provides functions that meet stated and implied needs when used under specified conditions

node.Title: Reliability
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component performs specified functions under specified conditions for a specified period

node.Title: Performance efficiency
node.Description: performance relative to the amount of resources used under stated conditions

node.Title: Usability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by specified users to achieve specified goals with effectiveness, efficiency and satisfaction in a specified context of use

node.Title: Maintainability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a product or system can be modified by the intended maintainers

node.Title: Security
node.Description: degree to which a product or system protects information and data so that persons or other products or systems have the degree of data access appropriate to their types and levels of authorization

node.Title: Compatibility
node.Description: degree to which a product, system or component can exchange information with other products, systems or components, and/or perform its required functions, while sharing the same hardware or software environment

node.Title: Portability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a system, product or component can be transferred from one hardware, software or other operational or usage environment to another

node.Title: Supplier
node.Description: Description about anyone who provides goods or services to a company or individuals.

node.Title: Cost
node.Description: Denotes the amount of money that a company spends on the creation or production of goods or services.

node.Title: Product
node.Description: Description about any article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale.

node.Title: Maturity
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component meets needs for reliability under normal operation

node.Title: Availability
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component is operational and accessible when required for use

node.Title: Fault tolerance
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component operates as intended despite the presence of hardware or software faults

node.Title: Recoverability
node.Description: degree to which, in the event of an interruption or a failure, a product or system can recover the data directly affected and re-establish the desired state of the system

node.Title: Time behavior
node.Description: degree to which the response and processing times and throughput rates of a product or system, when performing its functions, meet requirements

node.Title: Resource utilization
node.Description: degree to which the amounts and types of resources used by a product or system, when performing its functions, meet requirements

node.Title: Capacity
node.Description: degree to which the maximum limits of a product or system parameter meet requirements

node.Title: Appropriateness recognizability
node.Description: degree to which users can recognize whether a product or system is appropriate for their needs

node.Title: Learnability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by specified users to achieve specified goals of learning to use the product or system with effectiveness, efficiency, freedom from risk and satisfaction in a specified context of use

node.Title: Operability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system has attributes that make it easy to operate and control

node.Title: User error protection
node.Description: degree to which a system protects users against making errors

node.Title: User interface aesthetics
node.Description: degree to which a user interface enables pleasing and satisfying interaction for the user

node.Title: Accessibility
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by people with the widest range of characteristics and capabilities to achieve a specified goal in a specified context of use

node.Title: Modularity
node.Description: degree to which a system or computer program is composed of discrete components such that a change to one component has minimal impact on other components

node.Title: Reusability
node.Description: degree to which an asset can be used in more than one system, or in building other assets

node.Title: Analyzability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which it is possible to assess the impact on a product or system of an intended change to one or more of its parts, or to diagnose a product for deficiencies or causes of failures, or to identify parts to be modified

node.Title: Modifiability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be effectively and efficiently modified without introducing defects or degrading existing product quality

node.Title: Testability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which test criteria can be established for a system, product or component and tests can be performed to determine whether those criteria have been met

node.Title: Confidentiality
node.Description: degree to which a product or system ensures that data are accessible only to those authorized to have access

node.Title: Integrity
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component prevents unauthorized access to, or modification of, computer programs or data

node.Title: Non-repudiation
node.Description: degree to which actions or events can be proven to have taken place, so that the events or actions cannot be repudiated later

node.Title: Accountability
node.Description: degree to which the actions of an entity can be traced uniquely to the entity

node.Title: Authenticity
node.Description: degree to which the identity of a subject or resource can be proved to be the one claimed

node.Title: Co-existence
node.Description: degree to which a product can perform its required functions efficiently while sharing a common environment and resources with other products, without detrimental impact on any other product

node.Title: Interoperability
node.Description: degree to which two or more systems, products or components can exchange information and use the information that has been exchanged

node.Title: Adaptability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can effectively and efficiently be adapted for different or evolving hardware, software or other operational or usage environments

node.Title: Installability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a product or system can be successfully installed and/or uninstalled in a specified environment

node.Title: Replaceability
node.Description: degree to which a product can replace another specified software product for the same purpose in the same environment

node.Title: Organizational structure
node.Description: Description of the organizational structure of the supplier company.

node.Title: Positioning and Strength
node.Description: Description of the position of the supplier company in the market.

node.Title: Reputation
node.Description: Capability of the supplier to perform similar projects based on past experiences and certifications.

node.Title: Services Offered
node.Description: Description of the services offered by the supplier.

node.Title: Support
node.Description: Description of the support mechanisms offered by the supplier.

node.Title: Licensing Schema
node.Description: Description of the COTS component licensing options.

node.Title: Licensing Costs
node.Description: Detail of the costs for the different licensing options

node.Title: Platform Cost
node.Description: Estimation of the cost for the required production platform

node.Title: Implementation Cost
node.Description: Estimation of implementation costs based on similar past experiences.

node.Title: Network Cost
node.Description: Estimation of additional cost for network operation.

node.Title: Stability
node.Description: Attributes of the product that bear on the stability of the product.

node.Title: Ownership
node.Description: Attributes in relation to the intellectual property rights.

node.Title: Deliverables
node.Description: Detail of the out of the box and post implementation deliverables.

node.Title: Parameterization / Customization
node.Description: Attributes in relation to the initial effort required for the product to operate.

node.Title: Guarantees
node.Description: Detail of the guarantees provided over the product.

node.Title: Certification
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Publishing results
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Flexibility
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: ICT tool support
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Rigidness
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Audit
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Evolution
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Democracy
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Network
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Visibility
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Completeness
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: SDGs
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Transparency
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Simplicity
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Services offered
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Benchmarking
node.Description: (----------New Subcharacteristic--------)

node.Title: Self-assessment option
node.Description: The possibility to assess an organisation's performance[comma] using the method[comma] without having to pay a fee and/or without having to officially become part of the network.

node.Title: Certification
node.Description: After performing the ethical[comma] social and environmental accounting and meeting all requirements prescribed by the network an official document attesting to a status or level of achievement can be obtained.

node.Title: Score
node.Description: The accounting is quantified by means of a numeric score. For instance ""Company A's ESEA score of 2019 is 60/100"" (the scoring mechanism and range of the score is different for every method).

node.Title: Results can be published
node.Description: The network provides organisation with the possibility to publish the ESEA results (e.g. on the network's official website[comma] on verified social media accounts or in an online repository)

node.Title: Predefined indicators
node.Description: The method has already defined indicators that are part of the accounting. Examples of indicators are ""annual water consumption""[comma] ""number of female executives""[comma] ""minimum wages"".

node.Title: Extendable with indicators
node.Description: In addition to the predefined indicators extra indicators can be added to the accounting.

node.Title: Question/indicator explanation
node.Description: The predefined indicators are explained either in the method documentation or in an ICT tool.

node.Title: Official tool support
node.Description: The method is supported by an official ICT tool.

node.Title: Offline tool
node.Description: The method is supported by an official offline ICT tool.

node.Title: Online tool
node.Description: The method is supported by an official online ICT tool.

node.Title: Whistle blowing mechanism
node.Description: If someone sees that the accounting results are incorrect they can indicate this and the results in question are checked again.

node.Title: Built-in survey tool
node.Description: The ICT tool has a built-in survey tool that allows surveys to be sent out and filled in my users.

node.Title: Infographic generation
node.Description: The ICT tool can automatically generate an infographic based on the accounting data.

node.Title: Network tool (connect organisations)
node.Description: All organisation that apply the same method can connect and communicate through a special networking tool.

node.Title: Many users in one account
node.Description: Multiple users can be added to an account in the tool. This allows for designating responsibility of parts of the assessment to people in different departments[comma] functions[comma] positions[comma] etc. without having to share the login credentials of the main user. Adding multiple users instead of sharing login credentials creates higher levels of traceability.

node.Title: Tool is continuously improved
node.Description: New features and functionalities are continuously added to the tool.

node.Title: Internal validation
node.Description: The method documentation states that someonefrom the assessed organisation[comma] who was not involved in the assessment[comma] checks the accounting results (e.g. for inconsistencies[comma] invalid or incorrect data).

node.Title: Peer review
node.Description: Another organisation that applies the same ESEA method checks the accounting data of another organisation. This is done to make sure the data is complete[comma] accurate and correct.

node.Title: External audit
node.Description: An auditor designated by the network checks all accounting data for inconsistencies and compliance with the requirements set by the network.

node.Title: Existence of network
node.Description: A network exists of organisation that all use the same ESEA method for performing the accounting.

node.Title: Democratic method development
node.Description: During the method development input from the community is decisive. An example of democratic method development is when new indicators are added to the method specification based on votes by the organisations applying the method.

node.Title: Method is continuously improved
node.Description: Over time the method is improved and new versions are released periodically.

node.Title: Input from the community
node.Description: Mechanisms are implemented to gather input from the community (e.g. an online form on the official website[comma] a feedback field in the ICT tool[comma] special events)

node.Title: Local network groups
node.Description: The network has local groups based on the region. For instance[comma] there can be network groups per country[comma] per continent or per region within a country. The level of activity per local network group is not taken into account.

node.Title: Network specific events
node.Description: Special events are organised for members of a network. Events can lay focus on information provisioning[comma] networking[comma] discussing[comma] etc.

node.Title: Helpdesk
node.Description: A service providing information and support to practitioners of the ESEA method.

node.Title: Training material
node.Description: Anything that goes beyond the written material that can be used to learn more about the ESEA method or ESEA in general (e.g. workshops[comma] webinars[comma] knowledge clips[comma] etc.)

node.Title: Online directory
node.Description: An online[comma] publicly available repository where all members of a network are displayed.

node.Title: Map
node.Description: An online[comma] publicly available visualisation of a world map where all members of a network and their location are displayed on.

node.Title: Official label/logo for members
node.Description: An official label or logo of a network that can be used by members.

node.Title: Newsletter
node.Description: A bulletin issued periodically to the members of the network.

node.Title: Social topics
node.Description: Topics that influence groups within society or society as a whole (e.g. gender equity[comma] forced labour[comma] customer stewardship)

node.Title: Environmental topics
node.Description: Topics that consider harmful effects of human activity on the biophysical environment.

node.Title: Support SIP
node.Description: Either the method documentation explains how organisations should think about sustainability improvement planning or the network provides extra services or material that supports organisations in sustainability improvement planning.

node.Title: Suggested goals
node.Description: The method or ICT tool suggests goals based on the accounting results. These suggested goals can be based on the principles of the method as well.

node.Title: Ideas for improvements
node.Description: Either the ICT tool suggest action that can be taken to improve the ethical[comma] social and environmental performance of the organisation or the network provides a service that helps the organisation formulate ideas for improvement.

node.Title: Existence of social market
node.Description: The Existence of a space where organisations and consumers can buy products and services from organisations performing ESEA.

node.Title: Discount from members
node.Description: Members within a network can buy goods and services from each other with discount.

node.Title: Mapping to SDGs
node.Description: The topics and/or indicators defined in the method specification are mapped to the sustainable development goals. The mappings can help organisations report on the results of the ESEA; increase comparability between ESEA methods; help select relevant indicators.

node.Title: Workshop/webinar on SDGs
node.Description: Workshop and webinars on how to apply the ESEA methods in the context of the SDGs.

node.Title: Existence of aggregated report
node.Description: The network creates (annual) reports in which they aggregate the data from their members.

node.Title: Comparing results within network
node.Description: The accounting results of members are compared within the network.

node.Title: Serious blogs (medium[comma] network website[comma] etc.)
node.Description: The network writes serious blogposts for instance on their own website or on platforms such as Medium.

node.Title: Major newspapers (local)
node.Description: The network or the ESEA method is mentioned in major local newspapers.

node.Title: Expelling members
node.Description: Organisation can be expelled from being part of the network if they do not longer comply to their requirements.

node.Title: Commitment statement
node.Description: In order to become a member of the network[comma] organisations have to write a commitment statement.

node.Title: Public manuals
node.Description: Method documentation and tool support manuals are all publicly available.

node.Title: Mentioned in scientific papers
node.Description: The method and/or the network are mentioned in scientific papers.

node.Title: Tool or method adapts to organisational characteristics (e.g. size or industry)
node.Description: The method can be adapted to organisational characteristics (e.g. size[comma] industry[comma] company type)[comma] meaning the topics and/or indicators that need to be assessed might differ per organisation.

node.Title: Principle based
node.Description: The foundation of the method is a set of principles that every member should oblige to.

node.Title: Popularity in the market
node.Description: The state or condition of being liked[comma] admired[comma] or supported by many people.
